entry.content:
Motivation and Emotion

Fear of Failure    FOF
Achievement Goal Theory Mastery/Performance; Appraoch/Avoid  
Grit Grit, Conscioentiousness,  Grit, Grit-Short
School Academic Motivation (AMS)  
Interest Situational, intrinsic  
Procrastination Academic Procrastination  
Boredom    
Self-Regulation Self-Regulated Learning (SRL)  
Expectancy x Value, Utility Value, E x V + C Expectations for success coupled with perceived value in the task; or simply utility value; or with cost as a factor, as well Hulleman

 Implicit Beliefs

Belonging Stereotype Threat, Belonging in School  
Intelligence Fixed, Growth/Malleable Growth Mindset (Dweck), "I" pronoun (De Castella & Byrne, 2015)
Nature of Knowledge How do you know you know something? where does knowledge come from? Epistemic Beliefs
Self-Control Willpower, Self-Control MSLQ
Locus of Control  What is in charge of your life? LOCS (Nowicki-Strickland)
Value Self-Value, Boring but Important, Value of Education/School  
Personality Stability Whether people can change  
Difficulty Sanctifying, Impossible, Important  
Cognition NFC, beliefs about enjoyment of cognition NFC (Cacioppo & Petty), NFC-Short (Roets & Van Hiel)
Self-Efficacy Academic self-efficacy, college self-efficacy  
Entitlement How should the learning process work? What should teachers do for you as a student? Academic Entitlement Scale
Metacognition Usefulness... MSLQ?
Beliefs About Failure Who's fault, what caused  
Memory Photographic, Permanent, Fallible, etc. (stability bias) Metamemory in Adults (MIA) subscales (or short form...)
Studying Best way to, effective means/ineffective, Tendencies Desirable Difficulties Scale (Yan), MSLQ
Evaluating Learning Metacognitive Beliefs  
Beliefs about Future Optimistic, Pessimistic for self  

 Personality

Big 5 Extraversion, Agreeableness, Openness, Conscientiousness, Neuroticism FFO and short version, or TIPI (Gosling 2003), 16PF
Anxiety Similar to neruticism  
Narcissism    
Curiosity, Inquisitiveness Open-minded thinking, similar to openness (Big 5)  AOT
Most salient identities Identity-Based Motivation  
Mindfulness Several subscales (attention, self-compassion, -) FFMQ, MAAS
Perspective-Taking Myside or otherside thinking bias? Toplak?
Decision-Making Rely upon heuristics/intuition, or more analytical; how influential CRT (multiple versions)
Impact of Context to Decision-Making Propensity to rely more on context or logic for decision-making STSS (Novak & Hoffman), Rational-Experiential Inventory
Delay Discounting Consideration of future consequences CFC

 State (not trait)

Mindfulness Attention, Presence State MAAS
Depression Inventory of symptoms Beck, alternative scales
Life Satisfaction How satisfied with life are you? Or a component of your life. SLS (Diener), Student LSS (Huebner), Student LSS - Brief (Huebner)
Need Satisfaction Under SDT, how well have your psychological needs been met (perceived)?  (Ryan & Deci)
Recent Emotions In last 30 days, etc., how often did you feel... PANAS, Vitality (Ryan & Frederick)
Perceived Stress How stressed do you feel? PSS (Cohen et al 1983)
Learning Climate The learning climate questionairre LCQ
Attitude Towards School School, specific subjects (math) ISQ (identification with school), ATM (attitudes towards math)
Disaffection with Learning Attitude towards learning in general (EvsD)
School Engagement Levels of engagement with school / learning SSES, SEM, SEQ
